text:
e="preserve">David Michael Stratton (April 10, 1941 – March 25, 2020) was an American professional football player. He was a linebacker in the American Football League (AFL) and National Football League (NFL) for 12 seasons. He played professionally for the Buffalo Bills and San Diego Chargers. He played college football for the Tennessee Volunteers.
Stratton was born in Vonore, Tennessee. He studied at the University of Tennessee. Stratton died on March 25, 2020 of a heart attack caused by a fall at the age of 78.
